Related: This fragment was originally part of Tsagareli 93+92, which is now divided between Princeton (Garrett 24), Göttingen (Syr. 19, 23-25), and Birmingham (Mingana Georgian 4); Georgian NF 20 comprises 23 folios of this manuscript, which was also copied by Ioane Zosime and dated 986, cf. Aleksidze, et al., p. 393-395
Hand note: The manuscript has been copied by the scribe Ioane Zosime
Condition note: The parchment is fragile; all four sides are now irregular, with some splitting to the parchment along the ruled lines of the undertext, and losses to the inner areas of the leaf; dirt adheres to areas of the verso

Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Greek 446
Foliation: The number 59 was omitted in the foliation sequence; f. 58 is foliated '58+59', with the following leaf foliated as number 60
Collation: Quire 1: 1x8 (8), Quire 2: 1x4 (12), Quires 3 to 5: 3x8 (36), Quire 6: 1x6 (42), Quires 7 to 9: 3x8 (67; there is no number 59 in the foliation sequence), Quire 10: 1x10 (77), Quires 11 to 18: 7x8 (133), Quire 19: 1x6+1 (I140), Quires 20 to 25: 6x8 (188), Quire 26: 1x6+1+1 (196), Quire 27: 1x8 (204)|~|Each quire was numbered in the center of the lower margin on the concluding verso and the following recto, using the letters of the Greek alphabet, to ensure proper order when the manuscript was bound
Binding note: The original sewn book block (sewn on only three cords), and the original boards have been recently rebound with new headband and footband, the whole covered in a deep red polished calfskin of cheap quality, the inside of each board lined in modern paper, in contradistinction to Byzantine binding techniques; the metal post in the middle of the top board was retained, but no attempt was made to replicate the braided cord and loop that would have attached to this from the bottom board, providing the manuscript with a slight pressure when closed
Binding condition: The modern headband and footband have already broken because of the lack of flexibility in the binding
Condition note: All leaves palimpsested, some stitched together from two separate leaves of parchment |~| The parchment varies in color, thickness, and quality, because the leaves were taken from several different original manuscripts; the leaves are irregular in size, since they were left untrimmed after binding
Script note: A few large initials at the beginning of sections

Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Greek 930
Collation: Quire relations are difficult to determine, but can be established as follows: Quire 1 (6), Quire 2 (12), Quire  3 (21), Quire 4 (29), Quire 5 (35), Quire 6 (41), Quire 7 (49), Quire 8 (57), Quire 9 (66), Quire 10 (75), Quire 11 (81), Quire 12 (89), Quire 13 (99), Quire 14 (106), Quire 15 (114), Quire 16 (120), Quire 17 (paper, 128)
Binding note: Leather on wood, with stud holes on center of upper and lower outer boards; tooled lines on upper cover; incisions (secondary) on upper and lower covers; wooden peg extrudes from center of outside of upper board; remnant of leather loop on center of lower board; pastedowns of dark blue linen fabric on inner covers; total of seven metal studs along narrow edges of upper and lower boards
Binding condition: Binding intact with boards present and spine covered |~| Repair of outer board with tape; remnants of several repairs with glue
Ink color: black; initials and titles in red
Condition note: Codex with multiple signs of repair

Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Greek 962
Collation: Quire 1: 1x6+1 (7); Quires 2-4: 3x8 (31); Quire 5: 1x6 (37); Quire 6: 1x6+1 (44); Quires 7-8: 2x8 (60); Quire 9: 1+1x10 (71); Quire 10: 1x14 (85); Quires 11-21: 11x8 (173); Quire 22: 1x6+1+1 (181); Quire 23: 1x6 (187); Quire 24: 1x8 (195); Quire 25: 1+1x6 (202)|~|Quire signatures preserved at the beginning of each quire, except the first and the seventh | Presence of reinforcement strips at the beginning, end, and middle of most quires | Palimpsest is only in Quire 23 (ff. 182-187), which is more recent than the rest of the manuscript (13th c.), although the overtext is continuous
Binding note: Leather on wood, back and front cover consist of two pieces of leather; visible fabric layer, no paste-downs
Condition note: Codex with damaged spine
Script note: Formal round upright minuscule, which recalls the “Perlschrift”

Ink color: black-brown; some words highlighted in yellow

Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Greek NF MG 2
Contents note: Bilingual Greek and Arabic in two columns
Foliation: Foliation top margin in pencil by a later hand (followed here); some folios have additional foliation in pencil by a later hand in outer margin (which is ignored)
Collation: 1x2+3x1+3x2+1 (12), Quire 1: 1x8 (20), Quire 2: 1x4+1+1 (26), Quire 3: 1x4 (30), Quire 4: 1x8 (38), Quire 5: 1x8+1+1 (48), Quire 6: 1x6 (54), Quire 7: 1x6 (60), Quire 8: 1x8 (68), Quire 9: 1x8 (76), Quire 10: 1x8 (84), Quire 11: 1x8 (92), Quire 12: 1x8 (100), Quire 13: 1x8 (108), 1+1+2x2+1 (115)|~|Quire signatures in Greek on recto (and verso) of first (and last) folios of a quire (not followed here), beginning with quire number 18, as follows: folio 12v (end of quire 18), folio 13r (quire 19), folio 21r (quire 20), folio 27r (quire 21), folio 31r (quire 22), folio 30r (quire 23), folio 55r (quire 26), folio 61r (quire 27), folio 69r (quire 28), folio 77 (quire 29), folio 85r (quire 30), folio 93r (quire 31), folio 101r (quire 32)|~|Original quires 24 and 25 are missing, and some quires have folios missing
Illustrations note: Decorative bands in red and black
Ink color: black; initials and titles in red
Condition note: Unbound quires; some folios fragmentary |~| Folios have been cleaned and flattened
Script note: The Greek is a late inclined majuscule, with accents and breathings

Contents note: Missal (according to Tarnanidis) | Palimpsest suspected throughout

Illustrations note: Decorative bars in black, red and blue | Two round ornaments with inscriptions on ff. 13r and 20v, the first completely faded out, the latter with remnants of colouring (brownish red, black, blue)
Ink color: brown; initials in black, blue, and red
Condition note: Poorly legible overtext, some erasures due to scraping or washing |~| Folios and fragmented folios, some very small |~| Small piece in Envelope 1 with majuscule Greek writing was originally inserted between ff. 18v and 19r

Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Syriac 30
Provenance: The presence of quire signatures in Georgian, probably by a binder, points to the fact the manuscript was probably in Palestine between the 9th and the 10th c. CE
Foliation: Pencil foliation beginning with '4', intending to include exposed unnumbered front pastedown as f. 1
Collation: Quires are established according to natural movement of folios and do not correspond to original Georgian quire signatures in overtext|~|Unbound quires until f. 150; large number of singletons at the beginning and end of quires (usually quinions) that may originally have been bifolios belonging to a quire
Hand note: The manuscript was written by the scribe John of Mar Conon, Ma'arret Misrin (Syria)
Illustrations note: Black and red dots, in the shape of a cross or other shapes, mark titles or new segments of text
Binding condition: Large parts missing in front; back cover in two vertical parts, reattached with thread; exposed spine
Condition note: Mostly unbound quires |~| Most folios severely cockled, with raised ridges appearing as glossy; various degrees of discoloration, at least in part due to application of liquid in the course of prior scholarly investigation

Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Syriac 5
Related: Syriac 5 originally belonged together with London BL Or. 8607/I, Chabot 31 (Milan, Biblioteca Ambrosiana), ex-Hiersemann 500/36 (Tsu-Shi, Mie Prefecture, Japan, collection N. Yabuuchi)
Contents note: The parchment folios (ff. 1-103) contain the Pauline Epistles, incomplete at the beginning and end; the paper folios (ff. 104-198) contain Acts; the seven Catholic Epistles; and various liturgical excerpts
Collation: Palimpsest folios are in the third quire; Quire 3: 1x8 (16-23)|~|Quires are repaired with parchment strips with writing in Greek and Christian Palestian Aramaic
Binding note: Leather on wood; metal studs along narrow edges of front and back covers; leather fastening strip on back cover
Binding condition: Leather covering of spine and parts of back cover missing
Condition note: Codex with partially exposed spine |~| Stiff parchment folios throughout, many with signs of erasure

Author: Cyril, of Scythopolis, approximately 524-approximately 558
Foliation: Ff. 1-64 are unfoliated and fused together in upper part; foliation in pencil in bottom margin begins with f. 65; two detached folios at back foliated in pencil, both as f. 1 | Ff. 67r-72r do not open; ff. 74v-80r do not open
Collation: Regular quires can be counted beginning with f. 81, Quire 1: 1x4 (88); Quire 2: 1x4 (96); Quire 3: 1x4 (104); Quire 4: 1x4 (112)
Condition note: Unbound quires; ff. 1-64 (unfoliated) damaged and fused together in upper part; ff. 65-80 partially damaged; ff. 67r-72r do not open; ff. 74v-80r do not open

Title: Sinai, St. Catherine’s Monastery, Syriac NF M 56
AltTitle.other: Lectionary of the Gospels and Epistles
Foliation: Foliation in pencil in upper or lower margin, which sometimes includes numbered folios with the suffix a or b (e.g., f. 63, followed by f. 63a and f. 63b) | The original first five folios of the codex are fragmentary, not numbered, and are not considered here; the sixth folio in the codex is numbered 1, which is followed here
Collation: Quires 1-2: 2x12 (24), Quire 3: 1x8 (29b), folio 30 is a singleton, Quires 4-5: 2x8 (46), Quire 6: 1x12 (58), Quire 7: 1x10 (66), Quire 8: 1x8 (74), Quire 9: 1x10 (84), Quire 10: 1x8 (91), Quire 11: 1x8 (98), Quire 12: 1x12 (110), folio 110a is a singleton, folio 110b is the paste-down in the back cover
Binding note: Leather front and back covers; leather spine with reinforced fabric
Binding condition: Front cover detached; back cover attached; spine partially detached
Condition note: Until ca. f. 32, spine slants outward, resulting in curled folios
Script note: The script is artificial and recalls ms. St. Petersburg n.s. syr. 11, of possible Sinaitic provenance
